metadata.title: CVE-2021-3531 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Red Hat Ceph Storage RGW in versions before14.2.21. When processing a GET Request for a swift URL that ends with twoslashes it can cause the rgw to crash, resulting in a denial of service.The greatest threat to the system is of availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-base - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-common - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-fuse - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-mds - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-mgr - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-mon - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-osd - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-resource-agents - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
ceph-test - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
libcephfs-java - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
libcephfs-jni - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
libcephfs2 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
librados2 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
libradosstriper1 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
librbd1 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
librgw2 - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python-ceph - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python-cephfs - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python-rados - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python-rbd - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python-rgw - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python3-ceph-argparse - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python3-cephfs - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python3-rados - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python3-rbd - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
python3-rgw - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
radosgw - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
rbd-fuse - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
rbd-mirror - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
rbd-nbd - 12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.2.13-0ubuntu0.18.04.10').
